Helen Walker

WotD23 - Area

Aug 18, 2015

So the ex-maths teacher in me saw this word and started thinking about the areas of various two-dimensional shapes and the surface area of three-dimensional shapes.

[caption id="attachment_661" align="alignright" width="252"] Utterly unnecessary reminder diagram showing the area of a rectangle.[/caption]

As I'm sure you remember from your school days the area of a rectangle is the height multiplied by the width....

And you probably have this picture in your head right now... I do love a diagram...

I was thinking about that in terms of the work I do with people and I realised that there are two   elements to what I do. One is in the knowledge domain, what models I use, what skills I have, what theories I can explain, the other is the emotional perspective that I bring to that. The empathy, the enthusiasm and the desire to do the job well.

It is the way that these two things are multiplied together that allows me to have any kind of impact in my role.

Today's #PositivePostIt word is #Area #BrainAndHeart #Blog http://helenwalker.net/2015/08/18/wotd23-area/
